Reviews.Title: “Great value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Bdsqr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, service was friendly, and the rooms were spacious. As it's located in a residential neighborhood, it is nice and quiet at night (and day). Very adequate breakfast served, and the wifi worked fine. This is not the right hotel if you are expecting to spend a lot of time entertained on-site, but it is perfect for a business traveler or active tourist. Very centrally located and within short driving distance of anywhere in Hollywood / West Hollywood. Only drawback was parking - the hotel provides a pass to park on-street, but that means competing with everyone else who lives on the street and sometimes not finding a close spot.

Reviews.Title: “Another satisfied guest...”
Reviews.Author: worldly2
Reviews.Content: We can only echo the other positive reviews for this hotel. From Vicky's pleasant and helpful welcome in reception to the well-kept rooms, this is a hotel that is great value for money spent. Room 114 was, as asked for, very quiet as its window was on the narrow patio between the two wings of the hotel. We were able to spend a restful night on comfortable beds in a quiet location. As has been mentioned, it is an old hotel so don't expect a trendy, upscale property. It is more "old Hollywood" than anything else. Carpets could use some updating but they are clean and not shabby. Our only concern was parking as there is no dedicated lot, only street parking, which, as in most areas in the city, has severe restrictions. Weekends are easier and the hotel will accommodate you if you return home late on a weekend night - ask Vicky! There is a complimentary breakfast which we didn't stay for so we can't comment on it. In all, a terrific find in a normally upscale, expensive area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: israel g
Reviews.Content: on vacation from queens NY with family and really loved the hotel the room and the service everything was perfect would highly recommend and parking was always available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wilshire Crest Hotel in Beverly Hills for 1 night to attend a concert at the Saban Theatre. This hotel was very nice, quaint, quiet and friendly staff. The room was spacious and clean. Very nice, upscale neighborhood, close to restaurants and walking distance to the Saban Theatre. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl92103
Reviews.Content: 2 blocks from LACMA. Easy buses to downtown and Metro. Clean Up to date. Nice neighborhood. Reasonable breakfast and quiet. Extremely happy with the whole place.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in the Miracle Mile District”
Reviews.Author: Lucavigg
Reviews.Content: OK. So it's not the Ritz, but give me this over the Ritz any day. I can honestly say that this was one of the most enjoyable and hassle-free stays at a hotel for quite a while. I can't find a fault in any aspect of my stay here. The location was perfect for getting to almost anywhere downtown, museums, shopping at The Grove or Farmers Market and freeways for venturing further afield. Staff could not have been more helpful. I was concerned before arriving at some of the comments regarding parking in the street and the permit, but if you keep your wits about you and know what the rules are about where to park, you will have no problems. The furthest I had to park was about 200 yards away and the owner was also proactive with regard to the street cleaning days and making sure that guests were not parked in areas that were being cleaned. The room was comfortable, clean and large and my bed was very comfortable. There is also a small area out front to sit and chill after a days sightseeing or shopping. There was occasional noise from other guests, but I was never awakened or disturbed by any noise. Thanks to everyone at the Wilshire Crest for an enjoyable stay and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: JB_27_12
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely accommodating. I stayed there for 3 days on business and needed a quiet space to record an interview. They gave us an empty room, free of charge, to record in even after we checked out. Their flexibility was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Almost very good but not quite”
Reviews.Author: PogoJ
Reviews.Content: There is a good deal to like about the Wilshire Crest. It's in a good location and a pleasant neighbourhood. The owner/managers are very nice. The rooms are large and reasonably priced for LA. The bed was good and the linens were good quality other than for some pretty lumpy pillows. The bathroom was pretty recently updated, but still showing signs of wear. The breakfast was also okay, but it wouldn't take much to make it rate higher, such as baked goods of just a bit better quality -- the cottage cheese, tomato and cucumber is a nice touch. In my opinion this property would rate another star if not for the somewhat bleak nature of the room. A little wallpaper or fresh paint in a warm colour or, at the very least some pictures on the walls. A hotel that is just a few blocks from the LACMA might want to consider art as a way to add some life to its rooms and common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready to climb the stairs”
Reviews.Author: sheriff88
Reviews.Content: What an awful experience: The "non-smoking" room reeked of smoke residue. The exhaust fan in the bathroom was broken. There are insufficient electrical outlets in the rooms. Wi-Fi was slow and unreliable. "Continental breakfast" was clearly supplied on the cheap by the local Costco and Ralph's. And there was no bread at all. We asked for some, and were pointed to the bagels. Still using mechanical keys for the door locks, and cheap ones at that. And, THERE IS NO ELEVATOR. Anything above the first floor requires climbing stairs to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: ttavgct56
Reviews.Content: We stayed Saturday night just 1 night, but I would stay again, clean and comfortable. Nothing flashy, but for the price DEFINITELY worth it! You can pay more nearby, but if all you want is a clean room, comfortable bed, give it ia try.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel but not in a good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: sdgamer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times before switching to something nicer. The place looks like it used to be someone's house. The rooms are large and clean, but there are absolutely no amenities. No iron, no hair dryer, no alarm clock! I have to say that the room reminded me of a scene in a movie where the police break down the door and arrest the fugitive or parole violator. Depressing. The "breakfast" in the morning is not much more than cereal, muffins, juice and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay every time”
Reviews.Author: Vortmax36
Reviews.Content: The Wilshire Crest is a hidden gem in a prime location right in the middle of LA. The rooms are spacious and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. The breakfasts are plentiful. The Wilshire Crest is a great, small budget alternative if you're looking for a clean, comfortable and pleasant stay in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gil_12
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, Very good neighborhood, Big & comfortable Rooms, Very convenient for the religious.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our trip to Southern California extremely memorable.”
Reviews.Author: Darren520
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this boutique style hotel immensely.The hotel owner Aaron and his manager Vickie were very personable and helpful.We loved the location and appearance of the Wilshire Crest and would definitely stay there again.Our room was very clean and comfortable and the bed was super comfy.

Reviews.Title: “VERY WORTH IT”
Reviews.Author: beckinunez
Reviews.Content: VERY Comfortable room. We've stayed at other local places because we go to Cedar Sinai. this by far has Been the best and we will be back. It was also quiet and close to convient things. Recommend to ALL. OFFERED a continental breakfast. And coffee maker on the room. Some of the pricer motels don't offer either. If you are looking for clean and commfy this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: The location is good, close to subway station.Staff were friendly and helpful. The shuttle bus was a really good service

Reviews.Title: “Ampum Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ampum
Reviews.Content: Well placed hotel for the Jewish traveller as it is in the Jewish area and there are Kosher restaurants close by. The complimentary breakfast was also Kosher and perfectly adequate. The room was large and very comfortable and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. It was within walking distance of the farmers market and The Grove and also the Beverley centre although I did not do any sight seeing on this visit having been to several other places before finishing in LA I would assume it would be easy to join any tours from this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Irene Y
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wilshire Crest because of its proximity to Cedars Sinai Hospital. My sister is being treated there and the hospital had this hotel on its recommended list. I was extremely pleased with the clean, spacious rooms, comfortable bed, quiet neighborhood and very reasonable price. Plus, they provide a permit to park for free on the street. I plan to stay here again during my sister's repeated visits to the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LACMA”
Reviews.Author: StephanieWood
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our three-night stay here. The room was large and the bed comfortable. The night was very quiet. The complementary breakfast was all we needed and in a cheerful room with friendly guests. The walk to the LACMA was easy; there is also a great automobile museum nearby. Found a delicious Thai restaurant in a strip mall very close, on Wilshire. The sports bar was also fun and has reasonably-priced food. We had wireless Internet in our room. All in all, an enjoyable visit.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST LIKE HOME”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: i was in the process of relocating from NYC to L.A., I stayed at hotel for almost 1 mos..all personel and management went out of their way to assist me whenever requested. The other guest that I spoke with thought as I do, which is a very pleased guest! I would reccomend to travelers of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “my stay the wilshire crest hotel”
Reviews.Author: gittimaus
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the wilshire crest last week for 4 days.....i liked the room. also the location...the breakfast was ample, it included fresh fruit. everything was close by....at night there was no noise from traffic therefor very restful. the staff was friendly. i am planning another trip in july of 2012 and i will stay again at wilshire crest...

Reviews.Title: “Wilshire Crest Hotel, Los Angeles, California”
Reviews.Author: DFAB_11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week of Thanksgiving in Los Angeles and stayed at the Wilshire Crest Hotel. I can heartily recommend it. The location is good, rooms are large and well kept, with very friendly hotel staff at all levels. Lovely bath with lots of lights, and also good lighting in the room itself with very comfortable bed. Safe feeling with desk clerk 24/7, and a very nice continental breakfast included with the room in a separate dining room. Lovely lobby with comfortable chairs for reading and PC available for guests' use. Also a nice inner courtyard for relaxing in warm weather. With only 33 rooms, I'd recommend reserving well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: fatola4
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3 day stay at the Wilshire crest hotel. It was a very nice hotel the location was excellent , the rooms where large and the hotel staff where very friendly. The included free breakfast was a very nice touch. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay for a few nights in la on a smaller budget.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RachelfromOz
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2 adults & 5 year old twins) stayed here for 3 nights and had a really pleasant stay. The hotel is located in a fairly quiet residential area yet it is very close to a number of attractions including walking distance to museum mile and only a short drive from The Grove and Farmer's Market. It is also quite easy to jump on the bus from here down Wilshire Boulevard, as we did one day to visit Santa Monica. The rooms are very spacious and clean and we slept very comfortably in the beds. Breakfast was included in the cost of our stay and the hotel provided a nice spread which included cereal, bagels, fruit, muffins, juice etc. Overall this was a great choice and excellent value for money. We would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: BarryHoro
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 2 day stay at this hotel on a business trip. I was seeking a quaint hotel in a nice location and got exactly what I was seeking. The staff was friendly (the owner of the hotel even made it his business to approach me and discuss the stay. What a nice personal touch that you don't often receive from a chain hotel.) The location was practical (right off Wilshire Crest) and those seeking Kosher food would be happy with some choices for food in the vicinity of the hotel. You won't get the glitz of some of the other L.A. hotels but for the price and location, I really liked this hotel as an option. Clean and comfortable with a helpful staff. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel in LA!”
Reviews.Author: lovetodance418
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Marriott hotels since I sleep like a bably on their exquisite bedding. Well, the Wilshire Crest has matched their quality. The mattress was firm and the sheets. Besides bedding, the location is great! Thie two- story boutique hotel is in a quiet neighborhood one block from Wilshire Blvd. My morning walk was delightful and safe as I passed pretty homes and even a yard sale! Out front there are tables with umbrellas. I lounged here many mornings as I waited for family members to pick me up. The free breakfast is perfect! Pastries, donuts, hard- boiled eggs, instant oatmeal, cereal, vegetables, cottage cheese, fruit, coffee, tea, and juice. I did not have a rental car but was told that parking was free! The rooms have nice toiletries and even a mini- fridge. Best of all, the service is fantastic! I asked for directions and information many times and was greeted hospitably. A light over the vanity was out. I called and less than 5 minutes later, it was replaced. I will make this my LA hotel for sure. It was like a home away from home. The price much less than a Courtyard Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Road Trip 2011”
Reviews.Author: Freda H
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Room was spacious with bathroom facilities to match. Very comfortable. Staff went the extra mile and were most helpful and attentive. If ever back in Los Angeles this is where we will stay. Would recommend highly to friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cyndave111
Reviews.Content: This small hotel in a residential area was a great find. The rooms were clean and the staff was exceptionally accommodating. It was conveniently located and within walking distance of several popular attractions such as the Farmer's Market, the Grove, LACMA, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, smaller hotel -- great West Hollywood location”
Reviews.Author: Tony H
Reviews.Content: Thanks Tripadvisor. This is a great find, near popular West Hollywood attractions, well-kept, with a friendly staff. An older property that's been upgraded, the Whilshire Crest has a charm that's not going to be found in cookie-cutter chains. My room was spacious, nicely appointed, with fully renovated bath. And the wi-fi that's essential for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “A really great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAtraveler60763
Reviews.Content: Great low-key hotel. Very convenient amenities - free continental breakfast, printing at front desk. Rooms are spacious and clean as are the bathrooms. Stayed for a conference being held at the hotel, and I wouldn't have had it any other way. Within walking to The Grove, the Farmers Market, an LA Fitness, a 99c store, the La Brea Tarpits, the LACMA (LA Contemporary Museum of Art) which hosts an entire street of high-end food trucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: gwailoah
Reviews.Content: A ten minute walk from The Grove and Farmers Market and a five minute ride from Beverly Hills, this was a brilliantly located hotel for those whose budget doesn't stretch to the Hilton or the Intercontinental or who can happily do without the grand ambiance of these places. And with 99c stores around the corner to stock up on necessaries - a comfortable buffer against the shock of taxi fares in LA. Big rooms, everything worked, friendly staff. Kosher breakfast and free wifi - for me I would like to have seen better door locks and lockable safes in the room, though safety deposit was available at front desk. Also be advised, no elevator. But it's been there a long time and gave a nice sense of family tradition and history which put the tinseltown Rodeo Drive into great perspective. Definitely my first choice when I hopefully return to LA!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GrassDoesntGrow
Reviews.Content: I really loved my stay at this hotel! When i walked into my room i thought it was so big, but i AM from new york,lol. There was a comfy king sized bed and tons of space to lay out and hang my things. Theres plenty of outdoor space if you want to sit and chat with friends outside and the front desk is helpful as well. The breakfast has a great spread, hard boiled eggs, fruit, sweet pastries and bagels etc. and i always left really full and satisfied! Most of all the place was clean and everyone seemed happy to have me. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: intothewoods
Reviews.Content: I do noy understand the high praise this hotel gets. I only booked here due to the rave reviews. First of all if security is at all important to you, stay away. Interior doors are wooden. Our room had the safety latch removed, so we wedged a chair under the knob. On the first floor, rear there's a back door that remains unlocked most of the time. You can hear everything going on in the other rooms, including slamming doors at all hours of the night. There's also no parking lot, so you have to take your chance on the street and this is not an easy thing to do. They do offer a breakfast off the lobby, but it's awful! Also, the seats in the dining area were filthy.After complaining upon checkout the best they could do was 10 percent off. I was so disappointed in this hotel and it has shaken my faith in Tripavisor reviews. Please do not be fooled as I was.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Linda and Howar... L
Reviews.Content: The Wilshire Crest Hotel is the ideal place for the kosher traveler. We were in L.A. in August and booked two rooms for our family. The room rates are very reasonable, and the rooms are spacious, clean and nicely updated. The staff is friendly and helpful and someone is always at the front desk. The hotel is in a wonderful location, nearby many kosher restaurants and many L.A. attractions and shopping centers. A kosher continental breakfast is available every morning. The owner, Aaron, is very friendly and works hard to see that all his guests are pleased with everything. If we find ourselves traveling to L.A. again, it is the only hotel we would make our reservations at.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: amnonkal
Reviews.Content: Overrated.Extremely overrated.It is an average hotel without an elevator or bellboys. Yes,it's clean and well located but sleep quality is very very poor in some rooms as you hear traffic noise from fairfax avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great time - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Mavis C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when a family member was in a reality show at nearby CBS. It was very convenient to the farmer's market and the Grove shopping, and very comfortable and quiet. The staff was great and we will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cost effective place to stay but........”
Reviews.Author: anjcohen
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel in a good neighborhood location. The room had a king sized bed that was very comfortable. The room had a small table with two chairs but it would have been nice to have a comfortable lounge type chair to sit in to read or watch television. Overall the room was very good including the shower / bathroom. The free breakfast was just alright but no big deal. The hotel looks like it could use some minor repairs such as painting interior trim work and exterior trim. Our real complaint was from a customer service standpoint was when we requested a taxi. The front desk staff person called and the taxi arrived in a timely manor. The driver came to the front desk at which time my wife noticed the driver gave the staff member a few rolled up dollar bills for the referral. The horrible part was the taxi was awful! We were enclosed in the back seat of what appeared to be a old Ford Crown Vic police car with a divider. We were unable to place our feet flat on the floor and the cab was a rolling oven! No air in the passenger area and we felt as if we would faint! It was terrible. It is our opinion the hotel should have certain standards in regard to their taxi company referrals for their guests especially after receiving a referral fee! Not good. I hope this review assisted but make sure you ask for a room with a lounge type chair (not sure if they have it) and call for a taxi yourself that has adequate passenger comfort and air conditioning!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Local Place - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalJudy
Reviews.Content: My mom and I so enjoyed our brief stay at the Wilshire Crest in June. From the moment we entered the lobby, we found it to be a refreshing change from the feel of a big corporate hotel. While it's an older hotel, it's been remodeled with taste and class. We were greeted warmly, and check-in was easy. We were given an actual KEY to our room, and enjoyed a brief walk through the charming modern Asian ambiance of the large lobby and then a rather narrow (by modern standards) hall to our room which was really spacious, with a modern decor. Also, while the Wilshire Crest is snuggled onto a neighborhood corner, it's only a few blocks from restaurants and shopping at The Farmer's Market and The Grove. The friendly desk clerk gave us directions and we had a nice walk over for dinner that night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: RuthandVirginia
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for a week of vacation. We loved the Wilshire Crest. Typically one can't find a reasonably priced hotel within walking distance of attractions but this place is just blocks away from museums, the Grove, the Farmers Market -- plus I could run in the early morning through its residential neighborhood and feel safe. Best of all - free parking. The one time we had trouble finding a spot I left my keys with the staff and they parked for me. The room was clean and very big. As other posters have noted, it does not have all the 'extras' of bigger hotels, but the staff provided everything that was missing. The staff was always helpful. The shower had excellent water pressure. The beds were dressed with spotless white down comforters and half a dozen pillows. Breakfast was very handy although heavy on the sugar - even the instant oatmeal was flavored with sugar. To avoid sweets you'd have to stick to the plentiful (and fresh) bagels with trimmings. Regarding security - there was somebody at the front desk 24 hours and I felt very secure there. But if you are a person who is very nervous, know that the locks on the room doors are wobbly and the doors are not heavy and solid. This was not an issue for me at all, but I know that for some people a solid door with a key card is vital for their comfort The whole place was quiet but again, any noise from the hallway came right under and around the doors. My only issue with the place had to do with the placement of my room just over the kitchen - I woke to the sound of cupboards opening and closing every morning at breakfast time. To avoid that just ask for a different room. I can't say enough good things about the manager Aaron. He communicated with me very promptly in advance of our trip, greeted us by name when we arrived, and provided a fruit basket on our second day. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Many pluses, a few minuses.”
Reviews.Author: OhLoveNYC
Reviews.Content: PLUSES: EXCELLENT location, peaceful atmosphere, large clean rooms, friendly staff, nice continental breakfast, free parking, refrigerator in room. MINUSES: No elevator. Daughter & I had to schlep luggage up to 2nd floor. Street cleaning & nearby apartments caused lack of parking spaces. No ice machine, hair dryers, or irons in room. AC unit noisy & non-adjustable settings. We are mixed as to whether we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Dana H
Reviews.Content: This was just a one night business stay. I needed to be in Beverly Hills early the next morning and found this hotel on line for a reasonable price for the area. You would not expect to find a hotel in this neighborhood - residential apartments and condos. However, it is tucked in nicely. The street parking made this so much more convenient. No extra charges, no hassle with valet. Despite the room having a key versus a card access (something I had not seen in a while), the accomodations were great. Clean, quiet room with a spacious and well designed area for makeup and dressing. Bed was comfortable. The staff was attentive. Room did not have a blow dryer, but desk staff was happy to supply one. The neighborhood seemed safe and quiet. Alot of people walking dogs and normal coming and going of apartment dwellers. The hotel was walking distance from several small eating establishments, which again made for a very convenient stay. I will be back to this place --- suited my needs great!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Johanssen
Reviews.Content: Our experienced and the service from the staff were friendly and accommodating. The rooms were clean and well kept. The location was perfect for our needs, walking distance to coffee shops, grocery store and restaurants. The best we liked about this hotel was the quietness of the location and the wonderful kosher breakfast. The least was the hot weather, but what could we expect it was in August the warmest season of the year

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Lodging for Visiting the Miracle Mile”
Reviews.Author: Catherine H
Reviews.Content: We found our hotel room to be clean and comfortable with good maid service. The bed was comfy and the bathroom had amenities expected at this price. The breakfast included pastries and fruit and plenty of good coffee. The best thing about this hotel was that it is within walking distance of the LA County Museum of Art and the LaBrea Tar Pits. There are also other museums along Wilshire Boulevard. We also hiked to the famous Farmer's Market which was worth the walk to enjoy the holiday decor and lights as well as taking in a flick at the very nice cineplex located there. There are not a lot of restaurants right near the hotel. The best meal we had by far was at the LA County Museum of Art...the cafe (which has since reopened under a different chef and name) is outstanding, white tablecloths, superb wine list and the best salmon we had in a long time. Excellent service too!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: deeg324
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well located. The rooms were large and very clean. The beds were comfortable, the price was fair and they gave you breakfast. They also gave you a mini-fridge and free wi-fi ( there was also a computer in the lobby you could use) The rooms are not fancy, but they were very clean. the AC could have worked better and been quieter and I wish there were safes in the room. The parking is a little bit of an issue. There is no parking lot. You must park on the street with a permit from the hotel. Sometimes you wil circle the block a few times and have to walk a block or two. This is a residential area. I thought of it as a trade off for not having to pay for parking. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Think European style small hotel...”
Reviews.Author: maryrnsc
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable, and covenient stay for my 20 year old daughter and I. Loved the free continental breakfast and free parking. It is NOT a party/glamorous hotel and that's what I truly liked the most. When I return to L.A. I will stay here at my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price in the area”
Reviews.Author: tiggerx40
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean and super nice. Someone had mentioned that it was like an expensive hostel so I almost didn't book here. That was soo not the case. We stayed in room 208 and didn't have any problem with the noise. This is not a hotel that you would want to spend the day lounging around in but a great place if you go to a concert or museums, etc. I would say it would be great if they put in black out curtains because the light woke us up at 7am but overall well worth the money spent. PS- We found a parking spot at midnight right in front of the hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: drp528
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were pleased with our one night stay at the Wilshire Crest. It's in a nice, quiet neighborhood away from all the LA traffic (though parking, while free, can be difficult on that block). The hotel staff was very accomodating and the rooms, though dated, were sizable and the bed was nice and firm. It's also close enough to the main arteries of LA that going to Hollywood Blvd or the Farmers' Market is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: shawshankredeemer
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable beds, good amenities, and friendly, accomodating staff. We even extended our stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: MertonMary
Reviews.Content: Sometimes reviews just blow my mind. No room service, no hair dryer, no pool...did you not do ample research among a thousand hotels in Los Angeles? The Wilshire is perfectly fine. Very friendly staff, great continental breakfast, a peaceful environment, sizeable and comfortable rooms, free parking in a quiet and safe neighborhood. It was absolutely perfect for those visiting Los Angeles who are on the go and hotel amenities is not the purpose of the visit. Each morning I would take my laptop to the breakfast area and research what it was we wanted to do that day. There is a computer in the lobby but often times folks had the same idea I had so I found it more convenient to take my own laptop. The seating areas outside were great in that I could just relax as the remainder of my party was almost ready to go. The bathroom in our room was huge with a vanity just ourside of it so that a couple of us could be getting ready. We utilized the large closet and the refrigerator came in handy as we stocked it with water from the nearby 99 cents store...that's a place to see. The farmer's market was close, a great venture, and the beaches and other tourist attractions were all within 30-40 minutes of this hotel, including a drive up to Malibu. Beverly Hills is just a half mile away to the west and Sunset and Hollywood Blvds are just a couple miles directly north. The Wilshire was far better in terms of nearby attractions and necessary amenities than I could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “we really loved it”
Reviews.Author: michaelfulda
Reviews.Content: The management was really accommodating and attended to our every request. This was a family get together of over 25 adults from all over. We felt like we were in our living room, the breakfast was great, and the rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. This is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Find!”
Reviews.Author: Muse138
Reviews.Content: I googled a hotel near family I was visiting... and while the reviews for the Whilshire Crest were generally good- I watched for negatives other people noted in their comments. This is what I found. This is small hotel in a quiet residential area. There are umbrellas with tables and chairs just outside and it has a very relaxed and charming feel. I was concerned when I got to the front desk area which seemed a bit run down, but the lobby area is just lovely. I was also a little concerned when I walked to my second floor room- the halls didn't seem updated, but when I opened the door to my room I was Very pleasantly surprised. The room was very large, beautifully appointed, king bed, large screen TV, large sitting area, and bright sunny, spotless bathroom. The air conditioner was a bit noisy, but worked very well. The shower pressure was great. The only time I heard anyone else, was when I'd turned the a/c off in the morning. The free breakfast provided coffee, juice and tea. Cereal, bagels,pastry and fruit. It was clean, well presented and certainly enough to get someone thru the morning till lunch. The parking is on street, but they give a permit to each car, so you don't have to worry about meters or tickets. My only concern really was that the doors to the room were not upgraded, strong, the locks were what might find in a house... so I have to say, I did bring my valuables with me when I left the room... although they did have a safe at the front desk... I was more comfortable locking my stuff in the trunk. Overall great little find!! I thought it was a great find, I'd absolutely go back

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: flapfluit
Reviews.Content: They don't run a hotel, they have a hobby and are not really good at it. Our room was large but old and worn out. No hairdryer, no safe, no roomservice, no laundryservice, no nothing. Our room was above the lobby, my goodness!! NEVER accept this room!! You here the the staff avery mornig from 5:30 am talking with guests, answering phones etc. They don't care if you want to sleep, they pretent they don't understaand what you are talking about when you ask them to be less loud. The only good thing is the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a 'Hollywood' Vacation”
Reviews.Author: R_C_Alexander
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wilshire for two nights as part of a simple SoCal vacation this summer. The Wilshire is a great 'neighborhood' hotel, with comfortable rooms and great service. The Wilshire is a quiet hotel and seemed to be a favorite for Europeans on holiday, couples on a short retreat (like us), and others visiting family in the area. Great access to the LA Farmers Market, CBS Studios, classic Hollywood locations, Universal Studios, etc. The hotel staff went out of their way to call us when we left a cell phone charger in the room after we checked out. Since we were not in a position to drive back to the hotel, we told them to just keep it for the future guests to use. But they went out of their way and sent it to our home address instead! Just note that, as the hotel's website says, parking is free ON THE STREET. But since you're in a neighborhood, you have to be cautious of street cleaning activities (Mondays & Tuesdays) and its not necessarily easy to park some larger vehicles on the streets with the rest of the 'neighbors'.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: h0p_skip_jump
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had booked a guesthouse through Air BnB that turned out to be unlivable. In the middle of the night, I embarked on a frantic search for a nice but affordable place to Stay. I was extremely lucky to find the Wilshire Crest. When we arrived -- after midnight and very stressed out -- the lobby smelled of lillies and the staff was wonderful and welcoming. When we saw the room, which was generous and well appointed, we knew our Los Angeles trip had been saved. The Wilshire Crest is truly a gem. And it's even in walking distance of some of LA's best foodie landmarks. I hope to put guests up here frequently in the coming years.

Reviews.Title: “had surgery”
Reviews.Author: pokernomad
Reviews.Content: i had surgery near by, and was amazed to find out that the owner was willing to pick me up from the surgical suite. He was extremely kind, as I was in pain, and even patiently waited while I stopped to get food. The staff was very pleasant and the accommodations quaint. The fee was quite reasonable which included morning breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION and STAFF”
Reviews.Author: southerntraveler1989
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in May with an old friend. We needed to be the in West Hollywood/Beverly Hills area and this was a great location. Parking wasn't all that great but we found a space. Reached the Grove and Beverly Hills in very little traffic. The rooms were clean, but the beds a little hard. Great stay and the staff was very helpful. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ervinpf
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the friendly staff we knew we made the right choice. They were extremely accommodating and gave us really helpful advice The rooms are roomy yet cozy and very clean. The breakfasts were great and very generous. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance of the famous grove and farmers market and also the museums and tar pits. The area surrounding the hotel is also very nice and the hotel is quite charming. We had a great time there and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, sweet, unassuming little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marwylder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is delightful. I got lost on the way from the airport - Orange Street is not a main drag - and called the concierge for directions. Being direction-challenged and unfamiliar with the locale, I called twice, maybe three times. He was ultra-patient in guiding me, and when I arrived I was delighted to see a quiet, well landscaped, and unfancy little inn. The maid service (an iron and ironing board were provided at my request) and concierges were all friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, comfortable, and had windows that I could open. I've stayed at Sheraton and Hilton hotels and felt like a creature kept in an oversized, sealed container. This was so much better. I will definitely stay there again. As for excellence in cleanliness, comfort, etc., that goes without saying; those are features all hotels are supposed to provide.

Reviews.Title: “Like a home”
Reviews.Author: Kate293983
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week and a week end last month with my niece. Everything was perfect. We ask for a earlier check in. When we arrived at the hotel,( 2 hours before the time we told them), the room was almost ready and they invit us for breakfast till the room was ready. The staff was very helpful, especially Mel and Ross. The breakfast was exactly what you need to start your day. The room was very clean and huge. There is nothing that we ask or need that we didn't received. We feel like at home. Very good location, near farmers market.

Reviews.Title: “cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: retiredtravelers30
Reviews.Content: We actually loved staying here, we enjoyed the different people who were staying there at the time and even though it was noisy, it was a good noisy. Yes, parking is a problem, but we so enjoyed the beds and the breakfast and the outside patio that we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Essentially a Hostel at Hotel Prices”
Reviews.Author: bigfuzzybear
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing experience. Walls are paper thin. You can hear people cough or watch TV in rooms next door. Bed was not very comfortable. Room was musty and humid despite turning on the Air/Fan unit. AC/Heat unit was not temperature controlled. No incoming calls or messages; nor was there a clock in the room, or hairdrier, or safe. Linens and towels seemed slightly unclean. Breakfast was sugar with a side of sugar with some sugar on top: some bagels and jam, but mainly danishes and cakes. cream cheese and milk was on the table but was left out without refrigeration or ice. tables aren't cleaned by the staff, so they stay dirty after they were eaten at. On the plus side, it is in a great location. Room had fridge and two sinks, which was nice. Wifi and parking are included. Front desk staff are helpful. In sum: would not recommend and would certainly not go back. You can probably find a hostel for half the price and same quality. we are not sure why this is so high on tripadvisor....(currently #11)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidRose59
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for 4 days. Beautifull and large rooms.Very clean! Great beds. Breakfast kept us going all day. Will surely return!!

Reviews.Title: “comfiest beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: amberkm
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for the night after a concert and loved it! The place is so cute and best of all had the best beds! I honestly have never slept on such a comfy bed in a hotel! The staff was also very friendly, especially Aaron, the manager!

Reviews.Title: “Clean large room, but parking and breakfast leave a lot to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: JimboATL610
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it is close to our daughter's house. The room was large and well kept by housekeeping - good. Now the bad - parking is on the side streets o my, so you may expect to walk a bit from your car -especially if late in The evening. And the breakfast was a real problem. On our first day, it had been picked over at 9:00, and no one was replenishing it, even though breakfast runs until 10:00. We finally went to the front desk to get someone to replenish it. There are no tongs to pick up the bagels, rolls, muffins, etc. So people just pick through them with their hands to select the one they want. The yogurt, when present, is just set on the counter without ice to keep it cool, and the coffee pots looike they haven't been cleaned in some time, as the glass is stained brown. The final problem was several children, presumably the owners', as they would come and go through the kitchen door. They came in with bare feet, and would go up to the serving table, and since there were 5 of them, no one else could get anything as they stood there, pouring cereal, getting juice, etc. And once they arrived each morning, the ability to have a conversation disappeared, as they were very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Took a Chance - Glad We Did!”
Reviews.Author: CdnTrvllr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I normally veer to brand name hotels so you know what you're getting. We were working on a budget this time. Based on the price and reviews from here, we decided to try a 'Boutique Hotel'. Service - We were very impressed with the service. We arrived home late on Sunday night. The street cleaners were doing one 1/2 of the street (Mondays), so parking was full on our entire block. We stopped at the desk, and he said he left a bit of room where he parked in case this happened. So he went out and moved his car so we could fit in! Awesome! The free continental breakfast consisted of coffee, juice, bagels, sweet pastries, Cheerios, Cornflakes and yogurt. It wasn't anything to write home about but it did the trick to get our day going! If you're looking for more, there is an IHOP close by. I brought along a laptop (I've never used one before) and tried to access the WiFi (the person at the front desk gave me the code). I never did get connected. Could've been me? Either way, they had a computer in the sitting area by the front entrance that we used. Room - We were in Room 215 (view of apartments next door and partial view of front street) and it was just what you would expect. A bed, bathroom, a door for an option to use adjoining rooms, dresser, table with 2 chairs, wall-mounted TV, mini fridge, stand for setting your luggage on, and a very spacious closet. There was also a vanity mirror and sink outside the bathroom (which was very handy). We weren't expecting to spend much time at the hotel, so the basics were all we needed. Everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. We heard something through the wall maybe once for about 10 secs. That was it. I guess it depends on who your neighbours are at the time! Check out was seamless. We didn't get any 'surprise' charges. Location - We planned on doing the typical touristy things. It was great being so close to The Grove/Farmer's Market. It's only blocks away, and there were tons of dinner options there. We also caught a movie at the theatre there. We drove everywhere else (Venice Beach, West Hollywood, Rodeo Drive, Griffith Observatory, etc..) and didn't use more than 1/2 tank of gas in the entire 4 days. Everything is nice and close! We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbbiov
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location, quiet street very close to the grove shopping mall and to the LACMA clean and large rooms. Kosher breakfast.The Synagogue within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, well located”
Reviews.Author: knight2244
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an event at the El Rey Theatre, and wanted to be able to walk to the venue. The location was close enough that we decided that we could walk to and from the venue. The last two blocks of Wishire after LACMA are a wee bit on the sketchy side, but it didn't seem to be dangerously so. There's a Ralphs grocery store only four blocks away for groceries. And there are a number of restaurants on Wilshire in that same area. There's only street parking, which is a slight downside. We were fortunate to get parking right in front of the hotel. And we had a room that fronted on Orange, so there was plenty of light. I'm not sure what it's like for rooms more in the interior of the hotel. And while the walls did indeed seem fairly thin, sound from other rooms only seemed to be of issue when close to the adjoining walls. That was only an issue in the bathroom for our room. When we attend another event at the El Rey again we'll probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice, especially if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: kimfl
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly good hotel for the price, especially if you get a 10% off deal like we did through TripAdvisor. We stayed in Room 209, end of the hallway with no adjacent rooms, so there wasn't any noise problem. There's a mini-fridge in the room which is really helpful and not mentioned in some descriptions of the amenities (would be even better if it were accompanied by a microwave). Parking is only on the street, but we didn't have any problems finding spots within a few block radius.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Town.”
Reviews.Author: Jim_in_da_wick
Reviews.Content: If you need a retreat from the hustle of LA - the Wilshire Crest is your best bet. Quiet, in a residential neighborhood, but one block's walk from restaurants - the Wilshire Crest offers large comfortable immaculate rooms, excellent beds and linens, spacious work areas and vanities, expanded digital cable and large TV's - everything a business or family traveller could want. This is not the right hotel if you want loud parties, a pool, a bar, or a restaurant open till 2 AM - but the complimentary breakfast is amazing. I have found my oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: midbar
Reviews.Content: We were in Los Angeles for five days and enjoyed our stay here. The staff was hospitable and knowledgeable. Our room was clean and comfortable. The location, for us, was perfect be it for a Dodgers game, the Getty Museum and Villa, or the beaches. The neighborhood is very pleasant as well. If much of your trip to Los Angeles is based on westside activities, then add this hotel to your list of candidates.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: aibtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location! We rented a car in L.A for the week and were happily surprised to find everything we wanted to go to was no more than 10 miles away. As others have mentioned, the Farmer's Market, The Grove, and others are all within walking distance. Overall, the staff are very nice and helpful, the rooms are exceptionally clean and large for the price you are paying. Also, the free wifi is a huge plus! We chose this hotel specifically because it was the ONLY hotel we could find in our price range where no reviews mention bedbugs! I did not want to come home with that problem and you won't if you stay here. The only very minor gripe I had was that they mention "free parking" and I didn't realize it was street parking. In the end, it was fine because we found a parking spot every night, even when we got in late. If you are looking for a hotel with a lot of amenities, then this is not the place for you. That is the only reason why I can think that someone would give this hotel a lower rating. Its a great place to stay in LA and if I ever get the chance to visit again, this is the hotel I will choose!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location all the rest below average...”
Reviews.Author: Kobi_sh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wilshire for 3 nights- the location is excellent, quiet street very close to the grove shopping mall and to the LACMA and the Farmers market. The room is very basic, clean but no view or any special amenities, the walls are quite thin, so you can easily hear your neighbors and walking at the corridor. The breakfast is very poor- they need to decide to upgrade it to a reasonable standard or not to offer it at all..

Reviews.Title: “This would have to be the best hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: rocco85
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in LA many times and this is best located hotel to everything. You do not need a car at this hotel. It is within walking distance to the Grove and the Beverly Center in the nicest neighborhood. The bus station is only around the corner witch will give you access to everywhere. The rooms are very clean, big and the beds comfortable. The continental breakfast is fine, everything you need to start the day. I will be staying at this place again when i visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, charming hotel, sparkling clean”
Reviews.Author: grannysmithgreen
Reviews.Content: I had only two gripes about this place - first, the wifi was not very reliable, and second, the bed was as hard as a rock. Fortunately, that's the kind of mattress I like, so I slept like a baby. Front desk staff was helpful and polite, the room was way bigger than I was expecting for what I paid, and everything was clean and quiet and attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in the Miracle Mile”
Reviews.Author: katkrone
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully comfortable room in a little 2-story hotel which feels very much a part of the quiet residential neighborhood. Centrally located near Farmers Market/The Grove and the Miracle Mile area, near Wilshire and Fairfax. I was out from 8am to 8pm, so did not miss room service or having a restaurant on site. Near excellent dining. Comfortable bed, spacious surfaces in bathroom and large TV. Light bright enough to read! Glad to stay here again next trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “the best affordable hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: galgali
Reviews.Content: this hotel is amazing, i arrived l.a after staying in n.y in a room in the city which was at the size of a box, no breakfast and the location was terrible... after arriving l.a i was shocked by the amazing service at the entrance, by trhe size and the clean level of the room and for the fact that there was breakfast! the staff is the best and the owner even invited us to have the kabalat shabat in his house... no words!! the best hotel ever for this rediculous price!! dont think twice :):)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay....we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: legendstennis
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was close to so many attractions, one of the most important of which was our son and daughter-in-law, whose small apt. is a few blocks away. The Wilshire Crest is a precious GEM!! The hotel has the ambiance of a quaint European venue. It is friendly ( thanks, Mel and staff members), comfortable, clean, quiet, and inviting. The neighborhood is lovely and feels very safe. The continental breakfast is enough to keep most satisfied, although we usually added an egg sandwich from a nearby cafe. We stayed for 6 nights, 3 at each end of our vacation, and when we requested the same room as the first 3 nights, we were accommodated. I am a fanatic about clean rooms and this one was spotless! I also liked having a small refrig. in the room.The only "down side" was that our room had an older model TV. I trust some rooms are due for newer models. Other than that, I say thank you, to the staff AND to Trip Advisor where I first learned of this wonderful place to which we shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AF_Pil0t
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this was our first trip to LA. I usually pick the larger Marriott or Sheraton type hotels but I went with this hotel based on the ratings here on Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed. The strongest aspect of the hotel was the staff (very friendly/helpful) and the location. The desk attendant offered to give me his parking spot the morning after we arrived when I needed to move my car. Within two miles were the tar pits, Farmers Market and great shopping at the Grove (outside type mall). All the other tourist stops were pretty quick as well. Except when we drove to the beach, we were probably in the car no more than 15-20 minutes. (I did learn that making left turns in LA is near impossible without running the light!) The room had two beds, a mini fridge, wireless interenet access, large flat screen TV, a sink outside the bathroom and of course one in the bathroom. It was clean with plenty of room. Breakfast was a continental breakfast. It included bagels, several types of doughnuts/pastries, fruit, juice and coffee. As mentioned in previous reviews, parking is on the street parking. We stayed four nights and I never had a problem finding a spot except the night we arrived at a little past midnight. I parked in a bank parking lot on the opposite corner and made sure I moved it before the bank opened. I thought the neighborhood was nice and had no issue jogging through it in the morning. It didn't have a pool or gym or some of the other amentities of a large chain but the friendly staff, great location and family feel more than offset.

Reviews.Title: “Off Wilshire Blvd. Quiet. Suburban location.”
Reviews.Author: Pikelette
Reviews.Content: All previous reviews are spot on. A delightful hotel. And photos are a true representation. Exactly what I wanted to renew my memory lane visit to LA. The surrounding streets are a delight to walk around. Being a block off Wilshire Blvd. it was easy for me to get around without a car as there are corner stops for #20 bus & one block walk to Fairfax & Rapid bus. Free internet too. Good continental breakfast. Reception people were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean, quiet hotel with nice hot showers and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: blplusjp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wilshire Crest Hotel for 8 nights in early March 2011. This small 2 story hotel is located in a quiet residential neighborhood. It has no elevator, but a friendly staff member cheerfully carried our luggage upstairs to our clean, quiet, spacious room. The room was very comfortable, and included a small refrigerator, and a large flatscreen tv with lots of channels including HBO, The shower was nice and hot. The hotel was so quiet we thought we might be the only guests, but at the well stocked freecontinental breakfast every morning, there were always other people. Breakfast was always quite adequate, and often included yogurt and oatmeal, and always included fresh fruit, coffee, tea, OJ, several kinds of bagels, two kinds of dry cereal, and a variety of delicious pastries. In the large sitting room adjacent to the lobby, there was a high speed computer available free of charge to hotel guests. You just had to ask for the login code at the front desk. Parking is up and down the street outside the hotel with a free permit provided by the hotel. Additional parking is available 1/2 block away in the WellsFargo Bank lot if there are no spaces left on the street. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for a car free traveler”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Wilshire Crest Hotel and liked it very much. The room was big, quiet (I didn't notice any neighbor noises), and dark at night. It certainly wasn't fancy--there wasn't even a radio (and blessedly no minibar). The furnishings are perfectly fine, but not stylish. The Wilshire Crest is a two story hotel with no elevator, and there are no views to speak of, although the Orange St. side looks out on a pleasant residential street. There's free wireless internet, unlikely some fancier places I stayed. Staff was helpful. I almost never eat free hotel breakfasts, they rarely seem to be much good, and there are lots of good places close by for breakfast. At $125 per night, the money you save compared to other area hotels will fund your breakfast. There were a couple of hiccups, the room door one room required some jiggling of the key to open. The flush handle on the toilet was a little loose--it worked OK, but it should have been fixed and wasn't. I actually stayed in two different rooms because there was a break in my stay--both were good. As previous reviewers have noted, you can walk to a lot from here--the Los Angeles County Museum of Art and "Museum Row", the Farmers Market/Grove, restaurants on 3rd St. There's a strip mall with several restaurants a block away on Wilshire Blvd.--Cafe Latte is a very nice breakfast/lunch place. Walkscore--which rates how accessible stores and services are by walking--gives the Wilshire Crest a 97 out of 100, putting it in the top 2% of walk-accessible locations in the city of Los Angeles. Transit here is very good. I stayed without a car with no problem. Wilshire Boulevard has very frequent bus service west to Beverly Hills, Westwood (UCLA) and Santa Monica, and east to Koreatown and Downtown LA. Wilshire & Fairfax, about a 5 minute walk away, has a Rapid bus stop, and the Rapids move along quite nicely. Fairfax Ave. has good bus service north to the Fairfax commercial area (if you don't feel like walking) and Hollywood. There are also connections all along Fairfax to east-west bus routes like Beverly Blvd. Because the Wilshire Crest is very central to the visitor-oriented parts of LA, the travel times to these places are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good staff”
Reviews.Author: jworth1990
Reviews.Content: Was only there for one night. It was a nice place on a quiet side street just around the corner from the Israeli Consulate. I would describe the rooms as simple and roomy. The free breakfast was not much to speak of through. More like an Israel breakfast then a traditional continental breakfast that most people are used to in the USA. Parking is on the street and it can be a bit of an issue on a busy night.

Reviews.Title: “Totally exceeded my expectations - felt like family”
Reviews.Author: ODBxoxoxo
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to thank everyone at the Wilshire Crest Hotel in L.A. for making my first trip of many more, hopefully, a sweet, sweet experience. Mel and Aaron and everyone always greeted me with a smile, answered my many, many, MANY questions and got me extra things like salt to gargle a sore throat away, etc. etc. The hotel is central enough that I could walk to some places and cab to others without it being too cost prohibitive. It's not that no frills, as my room was spacious, had lots of place to do computer work, lounge and unpack ALL of my clothing. :o) Bonus mini fridge made storing food and supplements awesome. I try to be a health nut when possible, but even the lite breakfast of decadent desserts was too tempting to resist. I do appreciate all the fresh fruit, tea and OJ. I was actually sad to leave! This is definitely a hidden gem in the city. if you're not looking for extra frills like a pool or gym, you will really be glad you came here! There's nothing like unparalleled customer service when you're travelling. Thanks everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Affordable - A hidden gem close to Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: ochenas
Reviews.Content: Found the Wilshire Crest via my company's travel booking tool and it looked interesting - certainly different from the big places business travelers usually end up at. A scan of the web reviews were positive so I booked a room. The reviews were all dead on - this is a great boutique hotel. The room was spacious, the bed was firm, the water pressure was excellent and the entire facility was clean and quiet. I loved the little sidewalk patio out front and the manager Aaron was pleasant and gregarious. All in all well worth the low rate and I'd stay again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!! Loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: nbk2
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through TripAdvisor.com and it didn't disappoint! We did a Birthday Star Search for a friend's birthday celebration. We stayed here for 5 nights -- and it was wonderful!! Friendly staff, nice (simple) breakfast included - and we could not have had a more convenient location for our visits to TV shows! We were close to everything we wanted to see! 99 cents store was right around the corner for picking up snacks and bottled water. Small refrigerator in the room which was extra nice. Room was very spacious and clean. I would absolutely stay here again. The only slight issue we had was that the breaker blew when we dried our hair. But - as all these reviews say, the service was helpful and had us taken care of in no time (seriously, like 1-2 minutes). If you are looking for a safe, clean, reasonably priced small hotel to stay in Los Angeles in an absolutely perfect location, I think you should definitely consider Wilshire Crest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: km5088
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay near LACMA and this is a great place. My room was very spacious. Bed is very comfortable and breakfast is good. Shower amenities are of a very good quality. Room is very clean, stylish and modern. Hotel is very quiet in a good area. Staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Ears75
Reviews.Content: This is not a higher end chain, but I would say provides a good relative value compared with paying +$200/night for all the extras. it's friendly and clean, on a relatively quiet street just off a major road. I would only have two complaints. First the bed was too firm for my liking. Second, I thought the heater in the unit was very loud so we left it off overnight and it got quite cold in the room. Otherwise the room was spartan and the breakfast was no frills, but overall I thought it was good value. I think a good example of a independent proprietor providing good value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rfriedmann
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful place to stay. The service is great, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and every concern is addressed. I highly recommend staying here whether you are traveling for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Vortmax36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wilshire Crest for ten days in January, 2011. The hotel is in a perfect location, with easy access to most of LA. The hotel doesn't have a parking lot, but there's sufficient parking on the street. The rooms are lovely, with everything a traveler could need. There are no deadbolts on the doors, but the hotel seemed safe enough our whole stay, so it wasn't an issue. The bathrooms are nice, with sinks both in the bathroom and outside the bathroom. The only minor issue we had was the sudden change in water temperature in the shower. A nice hot shower could suddenly go cold without warning. The breakfasts are substantial and the staff is most helpful. The rooms are a good size. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent”
Reviews.Author: Canuckle154943
Reviews.Content: Required a hotel close to the Saban Theater-chose the Wilshire Crest based on mostly glowing reviews and the Kosher breakfast offered was a big plus. I arrived at the hotel at around 12 pm with official check in at 3 pm- was not able to get a room immediately,but the most gracious front desk lady ,assured me my room would be available shortly.Wasnt to unhappy to wait it out on the sunny front porch.Where I come from hadnt seen the sun in a while...... While I was out on the porch received a phone call and the phone was brought outside to me-a nice touch. The room was spacious and clean,with a flat screen TV mounted on the wall-lots of cable channels to choose from- wow off to a good start !! caught up on an afternoon nap ( the mattress was pretty firm) and at around 7'ish strolled down to the Saban Theater to see Eyal Golan in concert-great first day !! In a nutshell the Wilshire Crest is a very homely,quiet hotel in a decent location-close to Fairfax,The Grove,Farmers market etc. One thing to mention though- be sure to get a parking permit .I arrived on a Saturday and was assured I didnt need a permit over the weekends.I left early Monday morning and lo and behold a ticket for $63 was on the windshield of my rental car.Went back to the hotel and without any fuss or bother they kindly offered to take care of the ticket.Was much appreciated as probably I was half to blame, as I should have enquired about the permit on Sunday night. All in all a good stay- would definately recommend the Wilshire and should I find myself in LA again-would come back and stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant, quiet hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: HampsteadCBD
Reviews.Content: This a quiet, no-frills hotel with a homely atmosphere which concentrates on the essentials that a visitor requires. The room was very clean, comfortable and extremely large, with free Wifi and a solid table which made it possible for me to get a lot of my work done there. The bathroom had a great shower and bath with a generous supply of towels. Soap, shampoo, etc were replenished as required. Breakfast comprised limitless supplies of coffee, delicious bagels, Danish pastries and fruit, which set me up well for the day. There was a pleasant lounge and a verandah, where you could sit outside and - even in January - enjoy the Californian sun. I thought the location was great. Just a five-minute walk to the Los Angeles County Museum, and not more than fifteen to the Farmer's Market and the Grove mall. I had been told I would need a car in LA, but found it very easy to get to wherever I wanted to go on foot or by bus. I found the staff pleasant and helpful. I would have no hesitation returning here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the money !”
Reviews.Author: NYmilesman
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the hotel. It is in a great central location and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Beds were great, rooms were quiet and clean. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Los Angeles!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, wonderful, accommodating,clean,gracious staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sora18
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week end with friends. The staff were amazing. Everyone was sooo accommodating. The room was large and clean. The breakfasts were filling and delicious.It helped make our stay so great. I highly recommend this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing concierge service!”
Reviews.Author: julian35805
Reviews.Content: absolutely the best manager we ever experienced. could not do enough for us. beds were great with great pillows and duvee. we used the dining room for a private party for family, great atmosphere. 5 min walk to museums (LACMA and Le Brea Tar Pits). easy walk to synagogue (on Fairfax) and Starbucks around the corner. what else does one need in life!!! I needed a projector and the manager actually drove me around town to find the best rental then took the equipment back the day after we left town. Amazing personality to all the family.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and value for money. Staff very helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mike20342
Reviews.Content: Rooms very large and comfortable. Staff always very helpful and knowledgible. Nice atmosphere and close to the centre. Hire car a necessity to get around.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevenMan
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in the door I felt this hotel was different from other hotels that I had been to. It was very quiet and peaceful. The decor was beautiful. It felt like I had discovered a hidden gem. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Without wheels? Then, this is a very good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: casey17
Reviews.Content: From Saturday, December 11 to Sunday, December 19 I made the Wilshire Crest Hotel in Los Angeles my home away from home. This destination came from the recommendation of a local business in Beverly Hills. I was without transportation but found a short walk took me to many interesting and eclectic places: Rodeo Drive, The Beverly Center, Contempoary Art Museum and Farmers' Market. The charm of the hotel is only surpassed by the concern, warmth and helpfulness of the staff, especially the weekend receptionist. I am considering future visits to Los Angeles and definitely will return to the reasonably priced accommodations of the charming and elegant boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: jodie180
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this charming hotel located off of Wilshire Blvd. in Los Angeles with my husband and children ages 13 and 7. The location was convenient and in a quiet, pleasant residential neighborhood. The hotel itself is clean and pleasantly decorated. We had adjoining rooms that were nicely furnished and comfortable. Each room had a table and chairs and a small refrigerator. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed for the weekend and spent Shabbos at the hotel. We were able to arrange for kosher food to be delivered and the manager, Aron, could not have been nicer about accomodating our needs. A breakfast of cereal, bagels, and fruit and pastry was served each morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel for its service, value and location.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem, a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: tee4mee
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wilshire Crest and was pleasantly surprised by the clean rooms, comfy bed, and outstanding service by the friendly staff. The hotel is conveniently located to many great shopping and dining venues. The continental breakfast plus was a nice touch. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to family, friends, and associates.

Reviews.Title: “continental charm & location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: tip56
Reviews.Content: Looking for a quiet, service-oriented place to hang your hat in LA The Wilshire Crest is your best bet. Clean, comfortable rooms with all the amenities. 24 hour front desk help. Pleasant breakfast room and large lobby to meet friends or just lounge. The Los Angeles County Museum of Art is three blocks away and the Grove and Farmers Market six blocks away. Deli's, coffee shops, and bus lines at hand. An excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay Every Time”
Reviews.Author: RiceRivers
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here 4 times a year for the past few years. Everytime I am greeted warmly. I enjoy coming back here every year. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. I love the updates they have made. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet boutique hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: skaplon
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean and comfortable place to stay in a great location near Beverly Hills, the Wilshire Crest is the place to stay. The room was spacious and the bathroom was up to date and spotless. The flat screen TV had a wide selection of channels and the free WIFI was fast and reliable. The staff was friendly and courteous. A parking pass was provided for free street parking in this quiet neighborhhod minutes from many L.A. attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable, conveniently located, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: SkarShip
Reviews.Content: What a great find! Great location, reasonably priced, good sized rooms, and a very friendly staff. I will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: expl0rer21
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at well-known chain hotels. This time I tried something different and was pleasantly surprised. The Wilshire Crest Hotel is a charming family owned hotel with very polite and helpful staff. The rooms were large and clean. It is very close to the museums and other attractions around Hollywood. Overall a great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty dumpy - not as good as it sounds”
Reviews.Author: jmsroman
Reviews.Content: The hotel clerk first tried to assign us to a room near the back entrance where the door stays wide open all day with employees hanging out and smoking. The room also had a lovely1st floor view of a dirty wall and an overflowing dumpster. We asked to change rooms and were told no rooms were available. When I threatened to cancel because my pregnant wife can't be near smoking and a nasty dumpster a man came from behind the office and gave us a new room which miraculously became available. The new room was better, but had really old and rickety furnishings, a horrible musty odor, and uncomfortable bed, and a door that looked like forced entry was attempted on several occasions. All this for over $140 a night. Would have been better off staying several hotels on Sunset which we found out were far nicer and going for $120/night.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodation and service”
Reviews.Author: KOLOGA
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel, located in the neighborhood. Gives you the feeling of being at home even though you are traveling. Hotel staff is very friendly. The wireless internet service was reliable. Linen and beds were very clean and soft. Very comfortable small hotel. Enjoyed my stay and will be going back there next time I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff & Confortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Spyderdaddy
Reviews.Content: Room was nice & clean, staff was friendly. We were in town for my wife to have surgery at a nearby hospital. Centrally located near restraunts & shopping mall (Grove) Rates were reasonable and we would consider staying again if in town. Breakfast choices were a little sparse and could be improved somewhat.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: stb095
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. I really enjoyed staying there very much! its like a home away from home. the lobby is very cozy, with beautiful fresh flowers every day! i spend hours working in the lobby and felt right at home. Breakfast is fresh, simple and home like. I even invited a friend to join me fror breakfast and it felt like hosting at home. i warmly recommend staying there. The rooms are huge and clean. The only thing- if you are a light sleeper i suggest you sleep on the second floor--- since the ground floor is made of wood and you can hear other guests walking around in thier rooms in the early hours of the morning...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: JoeJohansen
Reviews.Content: Great, cozy place!!! Nice and friendly staff. Not a bad word to say about it ;-D Wheeeew!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the prize”
Reviews.Author: Musictraveler012
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big and clean. Very friendly staff. We used the breakfast room for meetings and it was perfect. There is wifi at the hotel, but it could be faster. I will recommend this hotel when i come back to denmark.

Reviews.Title: “Great .....Hotel,Location,Friendly!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ArielBrik
Reviews.Content: We reached the hotel after two weeks trip across the U.S., it was 11:30 at night the receptionist received us with a big smile and was very courteous, we got the rooms they were very large and very clean. Breakfast is definitely enough, but the most important part is personal attention received from staff especially the manager Aaron. Of course, excellent location, about 5 minutes walk Grove Mall. We will back to stay there. We had an amazing experience. Thanks Brikman Family

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: travelphyl
Reviews.Content: In the middle of Los Angeles 1/2 block from Wilshire Blvd., sitting in a lovely neighborhood, is this little hotel. Clean, well furnished, quiet, continental breakfast included, near EVERYTHING in Los Angeles's "Miracle Mile" of museums and shopling. Other hotels in this high priced area are three times the cost. Near Cedar's Hospital also. I will use this hotel again, and again. Only one draw back they have only street parking. This can be difficult but they really try to advise you how to beat the parking rush.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, and excellent value in West Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Janestigee
Reviews.Content: Between Fairfax and La Cienaga, this hotel is really conveniently located in a quiet residential neighborhood. It's also an excellent value for West Hollywood - a lot less than the jaw-dropping rate at Hotel Sofitel which is nearby. It's a little old-fashioned as for the amenities: no blow dryer in the room, but they cheerfully loaned one. No ice machine, but they'll bring ice to the room. Complimentary continental breakfast in a bright room overlooking a small courtyard was quite nice. There's no charge for parking - well, there is no on-site parking. We found a spot with no problem when we checked in mid-afternoon, and had our host call a cab to take us to Largo that evening.

Reviews.Title: “SImply Lovely :)”
Reviews.Author: ginopoli
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay a night near Cedar-Sinai Hospital. Although located in a residential area, this hotel was excellent on all levels. Comfortable, clean, beautifully decorated. Staff was helpful and super-friendly. There were two sinks in the room, one in the bathroom and one in the wash area - extremely convenient. Internet worked perfect and fast. And most surprising of all, was how quiet it was all night long despite it being in the thick of the city. So pleased to have discovered this lovely hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Last minute business trip”
Reviews.Author: advisor22534
