Reviews.Content: Was in LA for business for a day meeting, I flew out the next morning. Needed a place to stay just the night, my secretary found this place. I admit I was skeptical, as it wasn't a chain or familiar name hotel. Room was spacious, quiet location, very clean, bed firm, the hotel feels very much like a friendly bed and breakfast. Free wi-fi, great customer service. I'd definitely stay here again and will for future meetings! Ask for Aaron.

Reviews.Title: “Great European style hotel in beautiful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Texastraveller065
Reviews.Content: What a great find! The hotel is only one block from Wilshire and there are quite a few restaurants in walking distance. Exceptional staff and owner is very hands on in making sure everything is taken care of. Older rooms but have been updated and are large. There is only street parking available but they have parking passes at the desk. I had a very positive, relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bellatk
Reviews.Content: Last week me and my family have been in LA and stayed at Wilshire Crest Hotel a boutique hotel. It was one of the nicest hotels we stayed in during our trip in USA. The staff was so kind and helpful. I felt I was a part of the family, the rooms were nice and clean, the location was great and it was a great value for money. I wanted to thank the management and to share my deepest appreciation for saving my belongings which I unfortunately forgot but got e-mail next day to ensure me that they are safe at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Generous size Rooms, well loacted, no frills!”
Reviews.Author: ACabanaBoy
Reviews.Content: A good value for a budget hotel. Well located just off Wilshire Blvd, and very near the Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA), The Beverly Center (a multi-story high rise shopping mall, with fairly high end shopping). The room was large and very hot when we got there; but cooled fairly quickly when we turned on the air conditioner (each room is individually controlled like in a motel); the beds were hard as a rock; there was free Wireless Interenet the rooms and the entire hotel for that matter was sparkling clean! The hotel is not large which was nice, but has on street parking, requires a permit (which the hotel provides), which could have been a problem finding a space--but we managed. The neighborhood is mostly residential except for this hotel which is also nice. The breakfast is included and is fairly non-descript (Cheerios, Oranges, Danish- cut into tiny pieces, Tea, Coffee (but not decaf). The hotel is no Four Seasons, but neither is the price. If you don't have a big budget, then this is your place. Would I stay here again? Yes, I would.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home far from home at Wilshire Crest Inn”
Reviews.Author: chestnutEfrat
Reviews.Content: I would like to warmly recommend the Wilshire Crest Inn (Hotel) in Los Angeles. Thier facilities,location and other advantages ,you can easily find in thier website www.wilshirecrestinn.com . Here I would like to point out thier warm hospitality and good-feeling one can have while staying in Wilshire Crest Inn. You feel a real willingness to help you so that you will be comfortable and satisfied . A special recommendation I make here for the kosher traveler :The hotel provides you with facilities to enable you spending nice Shabat even far from home.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Phesie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. I was greeted by a basket of goodies in the room -- I thought it had been provided by the conference, but it was in fact provided by the hotel! Fruit, nuts, chocolate, water, etc. It was thoughtful and much appreciated. The room was large and the bed comfortable. When I arrived, the television wasn't working. I informed the front desk and they had it working by the next day. The rooms don't have hairdryers, but I was able to get one at the front desk to keep for the weekend. The dressers were old -- the drawers didn't have stops on them, so parents with children should be careful they don't pull the drawers completely out. The breakfast was satisfactory, and the people friendly. Parking was free but could be difficult to find -- I was lucky to get a spot right across the street. All in all a nice surprise in the midst of a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Totally satisfied customers”
Reviews.Author: oregonbranch
Reviews.Content: The Wilshire Crest is a lovely break from the "scene" that is LA. It is wonderfully located and incredibly convenient. They also offer extras like continental breakfast and permits for street parking without the constant nickel and dime-ing that occurs so frequently in LA. The staff was friendly and attentive. While the hotel is not fancy, it is clean, updated and practical. We will look forward to staying there again. Thank you all so much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, but no frills”
Reviews.Author: LoriFun-BabyBoy
Reviews.Content: Pros are its location in a quiet area, not a hotel zone, and reasonable rates. Cons are the sparse and austere amenities, and noise levels between rooms. We had a hard time sleeping due to a TV on in a room below us. No irons or hair dryers in the room but available by request from the front desk. Beds are rock hard. Breakfast was mostly a few white carbs and a pitcher of OJ. It was disturbing to have bathroom style key locks on the entry doors. Someone could have easily entered with a bobby pin or credit card. The staff didn't know anything about restaurant recommendations or places to visit nearby. There is one computer in the lounge but requires payment for use. Street parking only, no lot. Could be a knock out place with a facility update, more creature comforts like better mattresses and pillows, sound proofing, and some hotel customer service training and attention.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ChadStacy
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet, friendly, affordable. The staff is friendly without being overbearing. The facility is nice without being pompous. The breakfast is a tick better than your standard continental fare. Even the guests were quite nice. I will recommend this and stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Great Service. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: EMURDOCH
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with my stay st the Wilshire Crest Inn. I needed a reasonably priced hotel in a convient part of Los Angeles and I got exactly what I asked for. Walking distance to "The Grove," a stunning outdoor mall with a wide selection of upscale shops. Whole Foods is less then a mile away. There's a mini-mall with Subway, Fish Tacos, Falafel, Liquor Store... The beds are firm. I like a firm bed. I had a flatscreen tv with more channels than I could count. Spacious. Great service. I needed to print documents out and they were totally accommodating. Wireless internet. I'm very happy to give the this hotel a positive review because I know how hard it is to find the right place for the right price. For Los Angeles, this is it. Stay at the Wilshire Crest Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Run away from this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: NolanCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there for one night for business purposes. I was deceived by their nicely constructed website and inviting pictures. In fact, I stayed in the same room that was shown on their website. It is by far the WORST place I've ever stayed in. It is absolutely false advertisement claiming it's an "European Style Boutique Hotel" . The place is old, smelly, dirty, and gross. First of all, the room smelled as soon as I walked in. I killed a small cockroach in the bathroom. The towels and the bed sheets were not clean and had stains on them. I found 1 more small cockroach crawling on the bed. The furniture was old and dirty. Breakfast was pathetic with juice, coffee, rotting bananas and apples. I believed I paid $140 for the room, which is a completely waste of money. I just don't want any more travelers be deceived by their nice website. I don't have anything against the hotel or the owner, but I just feel deceived by their claim and pictures on the website. DO NOT go to this hotel, you will regret it and want your money back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Buy--Great Location”
Reviews.Author: texascouple21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived after the continental breakfast had been served; however when we checked in, they put out the breakfast again!!! What a start. The staff was friendly and very attuned to our needs. The room was very spacious and well equipped (refrigerator, too). Close to the Grove, Beverly Mall , Beverly Hills, and Cedar Sinai Hospital (which was the purpose of our trip). Cannot go wrong with this spot !!!! Highly recommended. Very homey feel.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic accommodations- at a good location”
Reviews.Author: Marhot
Reviews.Content: Location excellent, one block off of Wilshire on the ‘Miracle Mile’. Hotel was located in a residential neighborhood. This caused parking to be problematic. However, off street parking at bank’s parking lot across a busy street was available. Within walking distance to LA County Museum of Art and La Brea Tar Pits. About 5 blocks south of the Farmer’s Market and The Grove shopping center. This is an older hotel. Seems to have been an apartment building in it's former life. It is quaint and it does have an European feel; albeit a 2 star, 100 year old European hotel.. Floors were ‘squeaky’ & I could hear people in room above me walking. Rooms were larger than the average hotel/motel. Room was clean and daily maid service excellent. Our bathroom seems to have been remodeled recently. Bright and clean. However, several spot lights in the room were out. Knob on the heater/AC unit was loose and the knob controlling the vent was missing. Breakfast was true continental. Bagels, a few pastries, OJ and coffee. Not much compared the typical Hampton Inn/Holiday Inn Express fare. If you want a breakfast, walk 5 blocks to the Farmer’s Market for a REAL meal. This is a great value hotel, given the area it is located. It is what it is advertised as –a good, clean hotel. You will get what you pay for, this is not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Think Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: WendyPerrin
Reviews.Content: This hotel calls itself "a small elegant European style hotel" but, believe me, there's nothing elegant or European about it. It's pretty much the equivalent of a Holiday Inn Express (even the "free" continental breakfast is similar), only older, shabbier, and uglier. If all you care about is a clean bed, a hot shower, and a decent selection of cable TV channels, it will suit your purposes fine. At $112/night, some might consider it a good value, given its location. But I've gotten better values at other L.A. hotels (e.g. $60 at the MUCH nicer Hyatt West Hollywood) by booking through Priceline. Wendy Perrin

Reviews.Title: “I love this friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small friendly hotel. A place where I would feel comfortable and get a good night stay. I had heard good thiongs about The Wilshire Crest from my friend and decided to give it a shot. I would never go to another hotel in L.A. again. The rooms were very spacious, The clerks were more than friendly. I was able to get in and out of my room very quickly. One can not ask for a better location. I truely felt that the rate was underpriced for the service I got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Family and I had a wonderful time staying at the Wilshire crest Hotel. The rooms are large,the price is great and the staff is very helpful. We were walking distance to C.B.S.,The Grove, Beverly Center and Beverly Hills.I recommend this too anybody looking for a boutique Hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go.”
Reviews.Author: Brid
Reviews.Content: We chose this Bed and Breakfast because we thought the description sounded fine, a quiet start, probably jet lagged, before quite a hectic trip. We were probably the first to have our room for some time, it was clean but very musty and unaired. Browns and greens of the old fashioned tones. The beds were of the type found in cheap motels in the 50's and 60's. Not too uncomfy if you like hard mattresses and lumpy pillows. The linen was changed after the first night. Bathroom modernised. No tea/coffee maker. Please, in this day and age! A deserted and gloomy breakfast room with defrosted pastries and actually quite nice coffee. Sorry, this was so disappointing. We were fortunately only a short walk from the Farmers Market for some proper food although the desk clerk didn't know that. We should have gone to a proper hotel in the first place, because there is nothing worse than beginning a vacation wishing you had never gone away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn (Beverly Hills)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull Inn close to all shopping malls, resturants and theaters (Rodeo Drive) Continental breakfast, rooms are beautiful and spacious. TV and Phone Best of all great service and friendly staff. Abundance of beautiful fresh flowers.

HotelInfo.Name: Wilshire Crest Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6301 Orange Street, Los Angeles, CA 90048
